channel.title: Portforwarding need help =[
channel.description: Well i have a belkin router that has an "ethernet" cord hooked up to a 2wire modem to receive wireless internet. i have portforwarded but it has not worked. i have changed my hosting ip to my ip and client ip too it. and it says error connecting to server. I NEED MAJOR HELP i have teamviewer and msn. so please feel free to msn me~ donniefox@live.com

item.title: Portforwarding need help =[
item.dc:creator: @aces610 aces610
item.description:
@aces610 wrote:

go to your modem website then.

  1. go to setup / configuration
  2. advanced setup
  3. portforwarding
    4.add ip
  4. open up run type “cmd” then type “ipconfig” you wil get your ip adress dont use your default thats your modems adress
    6.port to port make it 43594 - 43594 udp and tcp make two and for your ip adress put what you got from the ipconfig.
  5. try to ping your modem if that works you should be able to make it open.
  6. make sure you have no-ip downloaded and make ur server ip.

Read full topic
